decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Site Location Plan IBISNIS-LP REV 0,
Proposed Site Location Plan IBISNIS-PSS REV 0 &
Proposed Floorplan IBISNIS-PFP REV 0.

Condition : 3 - Hours of Use - The use hereby permitted shall operate only between the following hours:

Monday to Friday 08:30 to 17:00
Saturday 09:00-15:00
Sundays and Bank Holiday's Closed

Condition : 4 - Fire Strategy - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Risk Assessment prepared by Sardar Abdullah Tahir Khan (dated 12th February 2025) and must fully comply with The Building Regulation 2010 (as amended) unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the development details of noise attenuation and noise management methods to mitigate against the likely impact of the proposed development on nearby uses shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved methods shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development.
Condition : 6 - Restriction - Use of Premises - The premises shall only be used for MOT testing and vehicle repair and for no other purpose.
Condition : 7 - All work associated with the premises (including any work on repairing motor vehicles) shall be carried out within the building.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant - Scheme Amended During Application Lifecycle
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was amplified with additional information following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made subject to an agreed extension of time.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
This planning permission contains certain conditions precedent that state 'before development commences' or 'prior to commencement of any development' (or similar). As a result these must be discharged prior to ANY development activity taking place on site. Commencement of development without having complied with these conditions will make any development unauthorised and possibly subject to enforcement action such as a Stop Notice.
description: APPLICATION FOR THE PROPOSED CHANGE OF USE FROM CLASS E(G)(III) TO USE CLASS B2 FOR VEHICLE REPAIRS AND MOT TESTING. THERE ARE NO STRUCTURAL CHANGES TO THE BUILDING AND NO AESTHETIC CHANGES .
